text.content:
Inpatient Note 
 
     ==============================================================
  CHIEF COMPLAINT(s):  Nausea.
 
  SUBJECTIVE:
The patient states she thinks she is starting to feel a little better.  Still 
feeling nauseated and doesn't feel like eating anything.  Vomit X 2 since admit. 
Dysuria and urgency continue but less severe.
 
ALLERGIES: METFORMIN, CITALOPRAM, FLUOXETINE
 
  ==============================================================
MEDICATIONS:
Active Inpatient Medications (including Supplies):
 
     Inpatient Medications                                  Status
=========================================================================
1)   AMPICILLIN/SULBACTAM INJ AMPICILLIN/SULBACTAM 1.5 GM   ACTIVE
       in DEXTROSE 5% IN WATER 50 ML  INFUSE OVER 15
       MINUTES IVP Q6H
2)   ASPIRIN TAB,EC  81MG PO QDAY                           ACTIVE
3)   CALCIUM CARBONATE TAB  500 MG PO TID                   ACTIVE
4)   CHLORTHALIDONE TAB  12.5 MG PO QDAY                    ACTIVE
5)   DEXT 5% NACL 0.9% INJ,SOLN in DEXTROSE 5%/0.9% SOD     ACTIVE
       CHLORIDE 1000 ML  75 ml/hr IV
6)   ERGOCALCIFEROL CAP,ORAL  1000 UNITS PO QDAY            ACTIVE
7)   GLYBURIDE TAB  2.5MG PO QDAY                           ACTIVE
8)   LEVOTHYROXINE NA (SYNTHROID) TAB  0.125MG PO QDAY      ACTIVE
9)   LISINOPRIL TAB  20MG PO QDAY                           ACTIVE
10)  SIMVASTATIN TAB  80MG PO QPM                           ACTIVE
11)  VENLAFAXINE TAB  75MG PO BID                           ACTIVE
 
ALLERGIES/ADRS:
METFORMIN, CITALOPRAM, FLUOXETINE
 
 ==============================================================
PHYSICAL EXAM:
Temp: 102.2 F 
P: 102
BP: 139/82 
Resp: 14
Pulse Oximetry: 94%
 
EXAM:
GEN: NAD, Obese female
NECK: absence of thyroid noted; no lymphadenopathy noted
HEART: RRR no M/R/G
LUNGS: CTAB no W/R/R
ABD: obese, NT, ND
EXT: no LE edema
NEURO: patellar DTRs are normal bilaterally
PSYCH: normal mood and behavior
 
  ==============================================================
  INITIAL LAB STUDIES: 
05/31/12  7:00    GLUCOSE              142H
05/31/12  7:00    UREA NITROGEN        34H
05/31/12  7:00    CREATININE           1.5H
05/31/12  7:00    SODIUM               138
05/31/12  7:00    POTASSIUM            4.2
05/31/12  7:00    CHLORIDE             106
05/31/12  7:00    CO2                  31
05/31/12  7:00    WBC                  8.5H
05/31/12  7:00    RBC                  4.2
05/31/12  7:00    HGB                  14.3
05/31/12  7:00    HCT                  42
05/31/12  7:00    MCV                  84.2
05/31/12  7:00    MCH                  28.2
05/31/12  7:00    MCHC                 34.6
05/31/12  7:00    RDW                  13
05/31/12  7:00    PLATELET COUNT       142
05/31/12  7:00    MPV                  7.5
05/31/12  7:00    BASOPHIL %           1
05/31/12  7:00    LYMPH %              23
05/31/12  7:00    NEUTROPHIL %         83
05/31/12  7:00    MONOCYTE %           1
05/31/12  7:00    EOSIN %              1
 
Cultures 
       Results of a urine culture were positive for Pseudomonas aeruginosa
       Blood culture was negative.
 
  ==============================================================
  ASSESSMENT AND CARE PLAN:
 
55  year old female with a pmh of   DM2, HTN , hyperlipidemia currently admitted 
with Pseudomonas Pyelonephritis.
1.      Pyelonephritis: doing better, continue IV Augmentin until afebrile
X 24 hours and taking PO without vomiting.
2.      DM2: continue glyburide.
3.      HTN: continue lisinopril and chlorthalidone; BP fine.
 
===============================================================
text.author: AVIVAUSER,THIRTY
